name: Digital Thermometer
instructions: Lubricate the thermometer, insert it gently into the dog’s rectum, and wait for the reading.

name: Tweezers
use: Removes ticks, splinters, or debris from wounds.
instructions: Disinfect the tweezers before use. Grip the tick close to the skin and pull it out steadily.

name: Scissors (Blunt-ended)
use: Cuts bandages or fur around wounds.
instructions: Use carefully to avoid cutting the skin. Clean and disinfect after each use.

name: Bandage Materials
instructions: Apply a non-stick pad over the wound, wrap with roll gauze, and secure with adhesive tape. Ensure the bandage is snug but not too tight.

name: Muzzle
use: Prevents biting when the dog is in pain or scared.
instructions: Use a well-fitting muzzle. Only use when necessary and never leave the dog unattended with a muzzle on.

name: Leash
use: Controls and restrains your dog if necessary.
instructions: Use to safely restrain the dog during emergencies or transportation.

name: Cold Pack
instructions: Wrap in a cloth and apply to the affected area for short periods, typically 10-15 minutes at a time.

name: Warm Pack
use: Applies heat to sore muscles or joints.
instructions: Wrap in a cloth and apply to the affected area for short periods. Ensure it's not too hot to avoid burns.

name: Latex or Rubber Gloves
instructions: Wear gloves to prevent contamination. Dispose of gloves properly after use.

name: Syringe or Eyedropper
instructions: Use to administer precise amounts of liquid medications or fluids. Clean thoroughly after each use.

name: Tick Remover Tool
use: Safely removes ticks without leaving parts behind.
instructions: Place the tool around the tick, close to the skin, and pull gently but steadily until the tick releases.

name: Flashlight
use: Provides better visibility of injuries, especially in low light.
instructions: Keep batteries fresh and replace as needed.

name: Pet First Aid Manual
use: Provides quick reference on handling different emergencies.
instructions: Keep the manual accessible and familiarize yourself with its content.

name: Blanket
use: Keeps your dog warm in case of shock or serves as a stretcher.
instructions: Use to cover your dog or to move them safely if they cannot walk.
